text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
passage: Summary: Scripture gives practical direction for daily life. Context: Psalm 119 celebrates the value of God's law as guidance. Application: When choices feel uncertain, look to foundational truths that illuminate the next step.

text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
passage: Summary: Faith trusts beyond current sight. Context: Hebrews 11 surveys faith-filled examples. Application: In seasons of waiting, lean on steady hope rather than immediate proof.

text:
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,
Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.
passage: Summary: The Spirit cultivates character in believers. Context: Paul contrasts works of the flesh with Spirit fruit. Application: Seek these character traits in everyday relationships instead of quick victories.

text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.
passage: Summary: Good deeds point others toward goodness. Context: Part of the Sermon on the Mount teaching about public witness. Application: Simple acts of kindness can make faith visible in everyday life.
importance: Be a light in the world

text:
For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:
Not of works, lest any man should boast.
passage: Summary: Salvation is a gift, not earned by achievement. Context: Paul emphasizes grace over legalistic boasting. Application: Receive humility and gratitude rather than measuring worth by performance.
Summary: Love is patient, kind, and enduring. Context: Paul's classic passage defining true love. Application: Let these qualities shape how you relate to family and friends today.

text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
passage: Summary: God has hopeful plans for the future. Context: Jeremiah's letter encourages exiles with a long-term promise. Application: Trust that setbacks can fit into a broader hopeful story.

text: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.
passage: Summary: Practice stillness to recognize God's sovereignty. Context: A psalm of trust amid chaos. Application: In busy seasons, pause and re-center on what truly matters.

text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
passage: Summary: Work with wholehearted devotion. Context: Paul gives practical advice for daily conduct. Application: Treat everyday tasks as meaningful contributions, not just chores.

text: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
passage: Summary: Ask for wisdom boldly. Context: James encourages practical faith that acts. Application: When unsure, ask for clear guidance and listen patiently for the answer.

text: Delight thyself also in the LORD: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
passage: Summary: Joyful alignment with God shapes desires. Context: David contrasts trust with anxious striving. Application: Prioritize what aligns with deeper joy, not fleeting wants.
